head.title: West ISD Health Alert News and Updates – West ISD's COVID-19 Response Plan – West Independent School District

img.h1: West ISD Health Alert News and Updates

br.span: This new site is a storehouse for all West ISD Health Alert information, news, and reminders relating to the Novel Coronavirus (COVID-19). David Truitt, Superintendent, will utilize this site to post all pertinent West ISD-related Coronavirus news and updates. The District will also publish all updates to the West ISD Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram pages.

span.strong: West ISD Coronavirus News and Updates

li.span: Posted March 12, 2020, at 7:08 PM: The Texas Education Agency (TEA) posted "TEA Updated: COVID-19 Initial Guidance and FAQs" - Link: https://tea.texas.gov/about-tea/news-and-multimedia/correspondence/taa-letters/tea-update-covid-19-initial-guidance-and-faqs
Posted March 12, 2020, at 9:13 PM: West ISD is at a Level I Alert Status per the linked (see PDF on the right-side menu) Region 12 Service Center Coronavirus Disease Alert Levels.

Posted March 13, 2020, at 9:33 AM: West ISD was notified that two, indoor events have been postponed: (1). The Region 2 Division 3 Boys Powerlifting Meet set for Saturday, March 14, 2020, at West, and (2). The District 17-3A UIL Academic Meet set for Monday, March 23, and Wednesday, March 25, 2020, in Grandview.

Posted March 13, 2020, at 4:40 PM: West ISD extended Spring Break through Friday, March 27, 2020. Please see the linked Skyward School Messenger (see PDF on the right-side menu). West ISD is at a Level III Alert Status per the linked (see PDF on the right-side menu) Region 12 Service Center Coronavirus Disease Alert Levels.

Posted March 16, 2020, at 2:33 PM: West ISD crafted and communicated two plans: (1). Meal Bag Pick-up and Delivery Options for all West ISD Students, and (2). Home Learning Activities Online Google Docs for all Grade Levels and Core Content Areas.

Posted March 18, 2020, at 9:25 AM: The next West ISD Meal Bag pick-up and delivery date and time is Monday, March 23, 2020, at 10:00 AM at West Middle/High School. The pick-up area is the cafeteria curb by the softball/baseball fields. Please look for the online form link from D. Truitt, Superintendent, if you need home delivery.

Posted March 19, 2020, at 6:14 PM: On Thursday, March 19, 2020, Governor Greg Abbott announced he had issued an Executive Order to temporarily close all Texas schools through Friday, April 3, 2020. With this news, West ISD extended the suspension of our daily district operations and continued our "work from home" learning plan through Friday, April 3, 2020.
West ISD announced that Report Card #3 was ready for review on Skyward Family and Student Access.

On Tuesday, March 31, 2020, Governor Greg Abbott announced he had issued another Executive Order to temporarily close all Texas schools through Monday, May 4, 2020. With this news, West ISD extended the suspension of our daily district operations and continued our "work from home" learning plan through Monday, May 4, 2020.

On Monday, April 6, 2020, the next phase of the West ISD Home Learning Plan began. New guidance on grading and course completion was issued by the Texas Education Agency (TEA), and the District responded with two, new pathways: (1). Prekindergarten-Grade 8 continuing on with revamped Google Docs, videos, and extensions, and (2). Grades 9-12 shifting to the Schoology online platform.

ul.li: Posted April 17, 2020, at 4:15 PM: On Friday, April 17, 2020, Governor Greg Abbott announced he had issued an Executive Order to close all Texas schools for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year. With this news, West ISD extended the suspension of our daily district operations and continued our "work from home" learning plan through Wednesday, May 20, 2020.

div.span: For questions or additional information, please contact David Truitt, Superintendent, at (254) 981-2000. Below, you find copies of each Skyward School Messengers D. Truitt sent out to all West ISD families beginning back on March 12, 2020.
